args: The moment of Tobias's trial has arrived.
I hereby proclaim the trial of\nPaladyn Tobias in session.
Inquisitor, you may present the\nfindings of your investigation.
The accused is believed to have harmed a\ndragon while posted in the Mistell diocese.
What reason does he give for this act?
He proclaims to have ＂done his duty.＂
I have a question for the accused:\nWhat ＂duty＂ do you refer to?
My duty is the same as all Paladyns:\nTo embody the creed of the Ilian Church.
That creed is at the heart of all I do.
You are suggesting you were following\nthe creed even while in Mistell?
Even though you attacked a dragon—which\nthat selfsame creed says we must revere?
Clearly you were not content with merely\nspreading your heretical teachings and\nfelt the need to claim the life of a dragon!
Tell me, do you worship the Other as well?
My heart is ever with Ilia.
And yet you are a fervent perditionist!
Lest we forget, the creed of the Church is:\n＂Respect both Ilia and dragonkind,\nand guide all people to prosperity.＂
That means Ilia's wish—and our goal as\nHer followers—is to grant happiness\nto ALL forms of life.
As the Other lives, so too must we accept\nand love him. Or do you suggest that\ngranting Ilia's wishes is also heresy?
The creed is meant only for pure souls!\nThe Other's soul was stained with\ndarkness, and so does not apply.
You would dare to call Ilia's own child\n＂stained with darkness＂?
Because that is what the Other is.\nTurning your eyes from this truth\nis foolishness itself.
I need not subscribe to your\ninsane beliefs, perditionist!
Calm yourselves. We have not come here\nto engage in factional disputes.
I agree—this is neither the time\nnor the place for such.
We've more important matters to discuss.
...Such as why the accused forgot\nthe will of the Goddess.
Another Paladyn stationed in Mistell\nhas given a most concerning testimony.
He claims he heard you say that ＂Ilia's true\nwish is heresy＂ before going into the\ndragon's forest.
We heard testimony along\nthose lines as well.
Your actions pollute the very goddess\nyou profess to follow!
To claim to act in Ilia's name while\nspreading falsehoods and creating\nmore heretics is naught but blasphemy!
The people of that diocese are not heretics,\nbut devoted followers of Ilia.
Then why did they drive members of\nthe Church from their village?
I can see two potential causes for\nfollowers of a church to turn on it:
One is when those followers cast aside\ntheir faith and become heretics...
And the other is when a church commits\na crime against those followers.

Did you not ask me to explain the reason
behind my actions? Then let me do so.
It all started when a child from that
village wandered into a dragon's forest.
The other knights, cowed by their\nreverence for the dragon, refused\nto go to her aid.
But if no one had gone looking for her,\nshe might not have returned alive.
Perhaps that was the will of the Goddess.
I have a question for all followers of Ilia:\nFor whom does the Church exist?
I will answer! It exists for its faithful—\nit exists for the PEOPLE!
Our Church exists to BENEFIT mankind,\nnot to harm it!
We are well aware of this!

Are you, though? I fear followers of the old
Church have become so focused on its
laws that they've lost sight of what's most
important: the happiness of people.

That is why I followed my faith—my
devotion to carrying out the will of Ilia,
who loves all living things—and turned
my blade on that dragon.
Logic is on my side, Father.
Tell me, what reason could there be for\nthe formerly devout followers of the\nChurch in Mistell to turn against it?
Their actions only serve as proof\nthat the Church has lost its way.
How much longer must we suffer these\ninane arguments, Your Excellency?\nDeliver your verdict and have done with it!
I will accept whatever punishment you\nsee fit to give me...but remember this!
Divine beings are only divine so long as\nthey have followers to worship them.
If the Church's leadership fails to grasp\nthis, then the Church has no future!
I've heard enough of your nonsense!\nI am ready to deliver my verdict.
Tobias is no heretic,\nbut a messenger of Ilia!
He found a lost child in the woods of\nour guardian dragon, and he did so\nthanks to Ilia's own guidance!
And he told me to believe in Ilia\nno matter what!
So I prayed lots and lots—and then we\nmade friends with the dragon again!
Child, are you telling me you rode here\non that dragon's BACK?!
The kid prayed to Ilia, and the dragon\nlent a hand. Sounds like the Goddess\nat work to me!
These villagers also testified that Tobias\ntold them to uphold Ilia's teachings.
Do you still intend to declare him\nheretic and see him punished?

I most certainly do—for he is a heretic of
the most dangerous sort! A man who
worships the Other over Ilia and whose
very existence endangers lives!
I am not the dangerous one here.

Indeed, I think far more danger is posed
by people who only cast their eyes
upwards, and in doing so fail to see
the common world around them.
A religion that disregards the well-being\nof its adherents will never save anyone.\n...But what of the opposite?

I believe that was proven this day.
Those whose welfare is cared for—
like these villagers—will reaffirm
their faith.
Silence! I will not be lectured on the\nIlian Church by someone whose soul\nhas been purchased by the Other!
You act as though I see you as my enemy,\nyet nothing could be further from the truth.
As I told you before, Ilia's wish\nis the happiness of all life.
So I must love you in her name\nas I would anyone else.
Silence! I have reached my verdict.\n...The charges against Tobias\nare found to be false.
His actions did not lead anyone else\nto heresy, and the dragon he harmed\nhas granted forgiveness.

If the dragon can forgive, it stands to
reason the Goddess has done also.
This is no heretic, but a Paladyn who
protected the happiness of Ilia's children.

But even if not heretical, acting alone in
such an extreme manner and preaching
that the Goddess condones heresy are
hardly praiseworthy actions. As such...
I take it you were responsible\nfor the villagers' arrival?
Yes, and I am glad we made it in time.\nHad the dragon not chosen to aid us,\nwe likely would have been too late.
You truly are a woman like no other.
And you are equally unbelievable,\nPaladyn Tobias. One wrong move,\nand you'd be on the stake by now.
If my death somehow led people to\nquestion the current state of the Church,\nit would have proved a worthy demise.
Still, I wish you would have at least\nconfided in me about all of this.\nThere was no need to shut me out.
If comporting with me ended up with\nyou being branded a heretic as well,\nwho would be left to realize our ideal?
Regardless, I'm thankful for what you did.\nThe villagers' testimonies will likely lead\nto change in churches across the region.
Still, I didn't expect you to be exiled to a\nremote northern region as punishment.
Sending you to Dezes makes it perfectly\nclear they want to be shed of you.
I care not where I am sent; my mission\nwill remain the same regardless.
Then let me end with this, Paladyn:\nit gladdens me that you yet live.
My thanks to the Goddess\nfor her mercy and wisdom.
(O Goddess above, permit me to mete out\njustice in your name for as long as I live.)
(If I am able to serve as your blade for\neternity, I will want for nothing else!)
